title: Dajipur Wildlife Sanctuary
subtitle: The Bison Sanctuary of Maharashtra
overview: Nestled in the Sahyadri mountain ranges near Kolhapur, Dajipur Wildlife Sanctuary, also known as the Bison Sanctuary, is a lush forest reserve famous for its rich biodiversity and scenic beauty.

The sanctuary is home to the Indian Bison (Gaur), leopards, deer, and a variety of birds and reptiles. Surrounded by dense forests, waterfalls, and serene hills, it offers a peaceful retreat for nature lovers.
Dajipur is a great destination for wildlife enthusiasts, trekkers, and eco-tourists seeking to explore the untouched wilderness of Maharashtra.

highlights.title: Indian Bison Habitat
highlights.description: Home to the mighty Indian Bison (Gaur), the sanctuary offers a rare chance to spot this majestic animal in its natural surroundings.

highlights.title: Scenic Safari and Trekking
highlights.description: Dajipur’s jungle safaris and trekking trails provide thrilling encounters with wildlife and panoramic views of the Western Ghats.

geography.intro: Spread over 120 square kilometers, Dajipur Wildlife Sanctuary lies on the border of Sindhudurg and Kolhapur districts. It is part of the Radhanagari Wildlife Sanctuary and forms a vital corridor for Western Ghats fauna.

details.label: Fauna
details.value: Indian Bison, Leopards, Deer, Wild Boar, and Birds

climate.description: Dajipur enjoys a cool and pleasant climate throughout the year. Monsoons bring lush greenery, while winters offer the best wildlife viewing conditions.

seasons.text: Monsoon (June–September): Heavy rains rejuvenate the forest, creating vibrant green landscapes.
Winter (October–February): Cool and comfortable, ideal for safaris and trekking.

geography.conclusion: With its dense forests, rich wildlife, and tranquil beauty, Dajipur is a must-visit destination for those who seek a deep connection with nature.

activities.title: Wildlife Safari
activities.description: Explore the sanctuary on jeep safaris and witness the diverse fauna of the Western Ghats.
info: Safaris are conducted in the morning and evening.
Book in advance through the Forest Department office at Radhanagari.

activities.title: Jungle Trekking
activities.description: Trek through dense forests and rolling hills with guides who share insights on local flora and fauna.
info: Popular routes include the Radhanagari–Dajipur trail.

activities.title: Visit Waterfalls
activities.description: During monsoon, small waterfalls and streams appear across the sanctuary, enhancing its natural charm.
info: The sanctuary transforms into a lush paradise post-rain.
Carry waterproof gear and proper footwear.

attractions.title: Radhanagari Dam
attractions.description: A scenic reservoir offering picturesque views and a peaceful atmosphere, located near the sanctuary.

attractions.title: Panhala Fort
attractions.description: A historic Maratha fort with panoramic views and deep connections to Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

marineLife.intro: Though not a marine site, Dajipur supports a rich diversity of terrestrial and aquatic wildlife species across its forest streams and ponds.

items.title: Amphibians and Reptiles
items.description: The region is home to frogs, lizards, and snakes that thrive in moist forest habitats.

items.title: Birdlife
items.description: Species like Malabar whistling thrush, hornbills, and peafowls are commonly spotted here.

conclusion: The biodiversity of Dajipur reflects the ecological richness of the Western Ghats.
Visitors are encouraged to respect wildlife and maintain silence during safaris.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Dajipur is located about 80 km from Kolhapur and 490 km from Mumbai.
Regular buses and taxis are available from Kolhapur city.

howToReach.title: By Rail
details: Kolhapur is well-connected by train to Mumbai, Pune, and Bangalore.

gallery.alt: Indian Bison grazing in Dajipur Sanctuary

bookingTips.description: The best time to visit Dajipur is between October and February for ideal weather and wildlife sightings.
Book safaris in advance and always follow forest department rules for safety.
Avoid plastic waste and maintain the ecological balance of the sanctuary.
